page.title: 07Farncombe Boathouse
page.content: The Boathouse is about 80 years old, the same age as the lock further up the river. The new boats now are up to 65 feet long, but the old boats are 70 feet long and 7 foot wide. 6 people work at the Boathouse building and repairing boats. The narrow boats weigh up to 8-12 tonnes.One of the new boats carries up to 10 people. The cost for hiring a boat for a week is between Â£100-Â£350. The river starts at Eashing. The canal was built from Guildford to Godalming in 1760 to join the River Thames 19 miles away. Narrow Boats were once used for heavy goods and now they are used for holidays and pleasure.
